pr_title: Add support for custom properties on anonymous complex schemas.

timeline.message: Add support for custom properties on anonymous complex schemas.

timeline.author: junchuanwang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -756,6 +760,26 @@ private RecordDataSchema parseRecord(
     return properties;
   }
 
+  /**
+   * Sets properties on the provided {@link ComplexDataSchema} using data parsed from the provided
+   * {@link AnonymousTypeDeclarationContext}.
+   *
+   * @param source source to read properties from
+   * @param target target on which to set properties
+   */
+  private void setProperties(AnonymousTypeDeclarationContext source, ComplexDataSchema target)

replies.bodyText: @junchuanwang No, since AnonymousTypeDeclarationContext and NamedTypeDeclarationContext are separate classes with no inheritance relationship. The only other option would be to pass in the parent TypeDeclarationContext object, but that would still require that the anonymous and named types have their properties extracted separately.
replies.author: evanw555

timeline.bodyText: Might be overkill, but I'd test to make sure the fields themselves have no properties.
timeline.author: evanw555
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -237,6 +236,32 @@ public void testNamedDataSchemaWithAliases()
 
   }
 
+  @Test
+  public void testComplexTypeWithProperties()

timeline.message: Add support for custom properties on anonymous complex schemas.
